text: 0.5l bottle. Pours in black colour with small off-white head. Aroma of grapefruit , spruce. Medium sweet, highly bitter, no sourness. Medium body, low carbonization,long lasting sweet and bitter aftertatse

From the tap at FOB, Rimini, Italy. Pours dark, very close to black, with limited cream colored foam. Aroma is rich: sweet, resinous, and herbaceous. Body is medium-dense and with some stickiness. Quite some tongue tickling from intense carbonation in the mouth. Taste is bitter, yes, but rich and full, with roasted and lightly smoked feeling and a sweet underlying taste. Finish is long.

Tasted from tap on the 07/05/2017. Hazy dark brown colour with a medium sized beige head. Aroma of coffee, roasted malts, caramel, hops and grass. Taste is medium sweet caramel and hoppy with a dry hoppy finish. Next one please!

Tap @ Irreale, Madrid, Spain.
Dark brown colour with a thick tan head.
Aroma is roasted malt, cocoa, hops, pine.
Taste is roasted malt, caramel, chocolate, hops, resin, herbs.
Medium body, moderate carbonation.

500ml bottle. Pours dark brown with small off white head. Aroma of berries, hops, pines, caramel, roasted malts, coffee. Medium body with average carbonation. Taste is light to medium sweet, medium bitter. Not your typical black ipa, but still very nice.
The beer has got a deep black colour with a small head and smooth body. Aroma pf hops and pine. Taste of hops, pine, spruce, woods, herbs, citrus and flowers. Hoppy finish. Wonderful.

Bottle, shared at Ians birthday. Deep ruby tinted brown, clear with a tan head. Perfumey berry and pine, dark caramel, very bitter finish. Not as good as the hype for me, missing the roast I was hoping for.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text:
21/XII/16 - 50cl bottle from Bierhalle Deconinck (Vichte) @ Syntra Gent - BB: 19/VI/17 (2016-1474) Thanks to Didier for sharing the bottle!
Clear dark brown beer, small aery irregular beige head, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: very sweet, honey, caramel, dried fruits, vanilla and milk chocolate. MF: soft carbon, medium to full body. Taste: very sweet and malty start, caramel, pretty bitter and hoppy, soft roast, chocolate. Aftertaste: caramel, sweet, honey, dried fruits, some chocolate, soft hoppy finish, nice beer! Probably much better fresh!

Decent aroma, although its more like a stout than bipa - some hops linger in there but it feels like there is more roastiness and a bit of chocolate. Taste is bitter with a bit of sweetness added to it. It has a smooth feeling - oatflakes-like. Overall a pretty good beer, although it doesnt feel like a black ipa - more like american stout.

Negro con reflejos rojizos, espuma beis.Tostados, cafe, pomelo y resinas en boca y aroma 
Muy rica.

0.5 l bottle. Pours dark brown, with beige head which quickly disappears. Aromas of hops, tropical fruits, resins, caramel, some herbal notes as well. Bitter with well marked sweetness, herbal aftertaste. Medium bodied. Quite unusual black IPA, but at the same time a very interesting and complex one.

tap/artefakt. ciemnobrązowe, piękna, biała, drobnopęcherzykowa piana, utrzymująca się do końca picia, piękne koronkowanie. aromat miodu, karmelu, brązowego cukru, biszkoptów, po ogrzaniu słodki likier i delikatna alkoholowość. w smaku pełne, gładkie, niskonasycone, początkowo słodkie, przechodzące w wyraźną wytrawność z popiołowym posmakiem, ładnie ułożony alkohol.
Malty and hoppy aroma. Lots of coffee, chocolate, smoke and flowery hops. A little too sweet to be perfect

This shit is so damn good and unique I almost forgot to make a note on it before it was all gone. This isnt your standard BIPA. This one seems more stout based in the aroma which threw me off initially. Oatmeal sticks out, a dark berry base lurks, passion fruit, roast, almond, pine in secondary - yea - that is an awesome mix. Taste follows up but the oatmeal fades out a bit, pine, citrus, candy, excellent bitterness, honey, caramel, wants to have heat but doesnt, dirt, orange peel in large chunks and lightly chewed (edit - this made me larf on the reread). Wonderful mouth feel - soft and smooth like a drier stout, lengthy managable bitterness, good stuff. This is the first 12$ beer Ive bought in a very very long time and it was totally worth it. I wanted every sip to last forever yet I just had to get more a second later. Exceptional brew indeed.

500 ml bottle, cellared over a year from purchase, best before: 19 01 2017.  Clear deep dark ruby red hued brown, mostly fading tan foam. Aroma of darke roasted malt, chocolate, herbal hop. Taste is rich sweet roasted chocolate malt, some black licorice, herbal floral citric hop. Well crafted. Average carbonation, medium-full bodied, well hopped. DNFL (Definitey Not For Lagerboys)

Appearance: clear brown with two fingers of rocky beige head, moderate retention and lacing. (4/5) Aroma: roasty malt, boozy dark fruit, chocolate, molasses, citrus, grassy/herbal. (9/10) Taste: moderate sweet, high bitter. (9/10) Palate: medium-full slightly slick body, moderate carbonation, lingering bitter warming finish. (4/5)

Hooo, yeah! Ive never had a Black IPA like this before - its really more like a (very!) hoppy RIS, than any other Black IPA Ive had. Lots of big sweet malt character melds extremely well with boozy dark fruit and massive hoppy bitterness. I think every other Black IPA Ive ever had has focused on the IPA side of things, adding a dark roasted malt note as something of an afterthought, that doesnt fundamentally change the body or overall character. This, on the other hand, is the bastard child of a heavy and sweet Imperial Baltic Porter, and a hop bomb A/IPA - and speaking of bastards, theres more than a little hint of Stones Arrogant Bastard in here, too. This is some serious shit that I highly recommend. (17/20)

A deep dark brown ipa with a super thick frothy lacing mocha head. In aroma, sweet nutty caramel malt with loads of resinous pungent floral hops, treacle, chocolate, light butterscotch, light coffee, very nice. In mouth, a nice caramel malt with loads of resinous herbaceous floral hops, lingering chocolate bitterness, resinous oily mouth feel, light treacle, very nice after more than 3 years. Bièropholie imports.

Aroma: explosive hops with notes of sweet malt, flowes and honey
Taste: roasted malt, hops, grape and plums. Notes of honey. Great mix of stout and IPA

Bottle to tulip
Consummation: Toasted malt, caramel, pine and loaded with bitterness
Adjunct: Aroma is primarily sweet malt with some toastiness and vegetal, at the end, I get some oatmeal and blackberry; dark reddish brown with a 2 cm, creamy light tan; nice one

Jo, Hops, Röstmalz und ein bisschen verbranntes Gummi in der Nase. Der Trunk schön schäumig wallend, klar mit ordentlich Rotefruchtcharakter und die IBUs kommen erst mit steigender Temperatur zur Geltung. Dann wird auch der hohe Alkoholgehalt spürbar. Ein rundum gelungenes Gesöff, könnte auch als Referenzstück für ein BIPA herhalten. Stark. 0,5/40DKK von einem Supermarkt in der Nähe der Brauerei.

500ml bottle pours almost black in color with a finger and a half of off-white head that leaves some decent lacing on the glass. Aroma is light roasted grains and chocolate with some citrus and grassy notes. Taste is a citrus and grassy hop bitterness with some light roasted grains and a dark fruity and chocolate malty sweetness. Alcohol is present in the finish. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Overall, a nicely crafted black IPA with a nicely balanced body and a nice blend of malts and hops. Recommended.

UPDATED: AUG 1, 2016 Une blackos super ronde, bien houblonnée, mais tout aussi richement fournie en caramel et en agrumes pour compenser, et dotée dune légère note torréfiée pour faire chic. Cest assez fat à boire, mais ça passe néanmoins tout seul. Bref, cest magique, et cest une sacrée tuerie !
Mörkbrun disig med smutsvit skum. Doftar och smakar lite citrus humle och lite karamellmalt/ choklad. Fyllig med rejäll beska. Perfekt bipa!
UPDATED: JUL 22, 2016 Дания - не родина слонов, а тем более пива. Диагноз - не пить.

Dark brown/black, unclear. Chocolate malt, grass hops. Roasted malt taste with caramel, bitter balance brought by the hops, grass and citrus. Hoppy, bitter finish. There is something special about Black IPAs.
Bottle. Dark brown, average creamy foam. Aroma: coffee, spicy hops, slightly roasted and burnt malt. Taste: malt, wine, coffee and roasted, fruits, nectar, sweetness and pleasant hop bitterness.

UPDATED: JUN 29, 2016 Brown, clear, biege head, high cabonation. Aroma: caramel and citrous, some dark fruits, malt, green apple. Full body, heavy to medium sweetness, medium to high carbonation. Quite a lot happening in flavour: lots of ester fruitness, some hop fruitness, caramel, dark fruits, biscuit, hay, coffee. Finish is fruity, hoppy and most of all alcoholic. Nice, but in my opinion rather barley wine than bipa.
Что то так сабе...(

Pours black with a medium foamy off white head. Aromas of chocolate, tropical fruit, roasted malt, roasted nuts. Taste is fruity and roasted with moderate bitterness. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation.

Fra flaske på DØE Lokomotivhallen mai-16 (dag 2) med Steven: mørk brun med kort skum. En vinøs, dyp og elegant black ipa hvor den høje IBU er forbilledlig skaber baggrundstæppet for smagen. Lækker, som så mange andre fra dette brygeriet.

Mörkt rödbrun, disig med medelstort skum. Fruktig doft med citrus, lite ananas, tamarind, lite örter, kavring. Smaken är syrligt fruktig med citrus och ananas och lite örter men här finns också rostade toner och rätt mycket lakrits och en skaplig beska som växer fram och blir till lite kaffebeska på slutet.
En riktigt bra svart IPA. Jag har annars lite svårt för den här hybridstilen, men här har man lyckats integrera IPA:an och stouten till något mycket njutbart.

Uit de fles geschonken (0,5l). Schenkt donkerbruin bier. Aroma is hoppig en kruidig. De smaak is complex: hop, chocola, citrus, drop, kruiden. Een prettig bitter bier, vol van smaak. Een hele goede black IPA.

Pours an opaque black topped by a coarse beige head, showing good retention and lacing properties. Nose is at first grapefruit, then doughy, wet grass and intense earthy hops. Very faint sweetness. The taste is semi-sweet chocolate, earthy hops and soapy yeasts. Full-bodied, dry, round bitterness with a long earthy finish. Complex. Cheers!
Zu alkoholischer Beginn, kaum hopfig. Im Verlauf alkoholisch, leicht bitter, süffig. Weniger Alkohol wäre besser. 13/9/9/9/7/9

Appearance: Colour is black. Head is brown, frothy, solid.
Aroma: Hoppy, citrus, roast malt, coffee
Taste: Initially sweet, strong coffee taste, later quite strong bitterness.
Palate: creamy texture, average carbonation, finish is long with aftertaste
I cant taste much IPA in this, the barley is very powerful and it reminds me more of a dark lager almost. Very intense flavour, the hops are coming through in the after taste
Bottle. Black pour, creamy head. Nice aroma of citrus, passion fruit, cacao and coffee. Creamy taste of coffee, passion fruit, mild licorice, citrus and chocolate. Nice beer.

Une black IPA, brune foncée, assez gourmande, belle densité. En bouche, notes malts torréfiées, café, amertume résineuse et finale sur pointe sèche, bonne tenue en bouche. Bière très intéressante. Joli packaging et format sympa, bouteille 50cl achetée chez Intercavces, Noisy-le-Grand, France, bue le 20/01/2016.

Tap @ Ølhus Stockholm, Helsinki. Pours black with a good, beige head. Aroma is fruity, citrus, some chocolate, light earthy funk. Taste is slight salty liquorice. Roasted, tar, light smoke, Some citrus. More of a hoppy imperial stout or something rather than a black IPA. Or I suppose a Cascadian dark ale, if you wanna use the term.

Bottle
Aroma-caramel, dark fruits
Appearance-brown, clear, tan foam, 
Taste-medium bitterness, lightly sour, light sweetness, 
Palate-medium body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-very good

Bottle at home, 17th December 15. Pours a lovely black beer with a good frothy head. Aroma is full, hops, citrus, liquorice, cocoa. Taste is is hoppy, bitter cocoa, great mouth feel. Liquorice, molassss also in the mix. A great beer

Flaska. Mörkt brun, närmast svart, med ett generöst beigt skum. Dofter av rostad malt, tall, karamell och frukt. Smakerna som framträder är nästintill magiska tillsammans, med en lätt oljig munkänsla och en fyllig kropp. Det är tall, grapefrukt, choklad, lakritsrot, karamell, citrus, det är lite kaffe på slutet. Fantastiskt!

Colore marrone scuro schiuma intensa beige chiara. Al naso tostato un po di nocciola. In bocca l iniziale sentore di malti scuri viene coperto da note di cacao pino per finire in un amaro secco. Ottima birra

Mørk brun klar med fingerhøyt beige skum. Lukter korn, noe karamell og kaffe, men hovedsakelig en fruktig lukt mot sitrusskall og blomster. Fyldig. Medium bitter varig smak, noe pepperig og dyp fruktighet.

Look; beige film, near clear ultra dark ruby body. Aroma; roasted malts, hoppy pine forest, notes of nuts n prunes, inviting good scents. Taste; powerful roasted malts, strong dark fruits, nutty liquorish black syrup, roasted resin, black fruity cocoa - leading to a finish in strong chocolate-resin, some mint or anise, lingering nice. On palate very good body and smooth carbonation. Overall; imperial quality black IPA, should be enjoyed slowly. UPDATED: FEB 16, 2017 Meget spændende Dark IPA. Meget humlet. Særdeles smagfuld. Flot farve og creamet skum

Flaska från SB. Mörkt brunröd med tunnt beiget skum. Doftar amerikansk Imperial IPA: tallskott, gräsig maltsötma. Fruktigheten tillbakahållen. Mycket mer IPA än stout i doften. De rökiga kaffetonerna ligger långt bak. Fyllig kropp som sväller härligt i munnen. Smaken inleds likt doften men ger snart plats åt de mörkrostade kaffetonerna. Går över i en bra efterbeska som tillsammans med kaffetonerna håller i sig en bra stund. Överlag inget stort fan av svart IPA, men denna är bra gjord.

Backlog rating. Keg at CBC Covent Garden, London. It pours a dark brown color with medium beige head. Aroma is roasted malts gras pine cones and resin. Taste is dark chocolate cocoa roasted malts pine cones and resin. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, good one

Hoppy aroma with hints of hay.. Dark brown wonderful light beige head.
Exelent taste, burnt malt,huge bitterness yet very drinkable.
Long aftertaste, bitter, sweet, the sort that invites to another sip.
Great beer... Cheers

On draught at Beer OClock, Annecy. Light to mid-brown with a fair bit of tan head. Pine resin mixes with naked alcohol in the aroma. Starts sweet, the the back-of-the-throat bitterness kicks in. Very bitter finish. Oak chips and dark chocolate in the aftertaste, along with caramel and that intense pine. Yum.

Pours dark dark brown with medium off white head
Aromas of coffee, chocolate, roasted malts, tropical fruityness
Taste very nice of sweet caramel, chocolate, hints of coffee, tropical fruits
Medium to full bodied with medium carbonation and a quite long bitter finish
Uma Imperial Black IPA amarga e torrada, porém muito equilibrada. Os lúpulos utilizados certamente respondem pelo agradável sabor de frutas percebido. Excelente.
Mörkt röd-brun, tätt latte färgat skum. Doft: Humle, rostat, nötkola, smörkola, skogsjord, lite kaffe. Smak: Som doft + malt, godis.
Flaska delad med @thaalcoholic, tack! Colafärgad med ljust skum. Doftar humlig stout med tydliga drag åt vanilj. Kraftfull där alla smaker sitter. Den här tror jag skulle falla dig i smaken Peter

Draught. Black colour, white dense head. Aroma of tropical fruits, malty sweetness and low roastiness. In taste sweet, lightly toasted with citrusy notes. Full bodied, medium carbonation, no alcohol in flavour. All finished with strong bitterness. Good.

Pours deep brown to black with two fingers of light tan head leaving quite a bit of lacing. Aroma of citrus, coffee, chocolate and roasty malt. Taste is hoppy and citrusy with lingering coffee bitter finish. Light, smooth body with soft carbonation.

A nice full head. Chocolate, malt and fruity hops in the nose. Taste follows the same, first chocolate with rich malts, then fruity hops, could have wished for a bit more citrustones. But still a really nice one.

500ml bottle from Systembolaget. Dark brown with a creamy beige long lasting head. Hoppy and roasted aroma, chocolate, caramel, citrus, hay, grass. Medium carbonated, smooth creamy mouthfeel. Wonderfully balanced taste of hops and malt, citrus, grapefruit, grassy hops, floral notes with roasted malt notes, caramel, chocolate, coffee. Finish with a bitter taste of cocoa and citrus. Well made!

Aroma is sharp and in your face from resin, roasted malts and a tad of herbs. Taste is at first a perfect mix between fruits and darkness, pretty soon the bitterness kicks in, and man is that a kick to the groin or what? I love the aftertaste, a sharp hop bitterness that almost turns into a oily, soapy sensation. I like this one a lot. It cold be one of the best BIPAs out there.

(500ml bottle from Systembolaget) Pours very dark brown with a moderate lingering whitish head and lots of lace. Aroma of dark malts, chocolate, plum, blackberry, caramel, light smoke, hop resins grassy with light citrus hints. Palate has a full sweet malt core of caramel, dark chocolate, blackberry hitting at first, smoky roast malts and resinous hops building in the middle to a dry and astringent finish of fairly high bitterness. A little peppery herbal bite to the middle. Medium slick body with below-average carb and a slight hint of alcohol. Hides its IBUs pretty well at the start but they definitely punch through by the finish. Not super-bright hopping, maybe partly age but seems more hoppy imperial porter than many hop-forward black IPAs. Quite nice, in that context.
Just numeral ratings due to social interaction. Yes, there is still some. Even though smart phones exist.

Very dark, black with hints of brown. Nice brown head. Aroma has chocolate, roast and slight caramel, maybe. Taste coffee turns into roastiness. Very bitter but the sweetness covers it well. After taste is very dry.

Bottle. Sensoric. Deep brown with medium, light brown head. Medicore head retention and lacing. Nice medium aroma of caramel mixed with dried, black fruits (mainly rasins, plums) - like plum in a chocolate. At first Id say semi-sweet, but later on it turns into medium to high bitter. Medium to full body, oily and sticku texture, average carbonation, finish is semi-dry and short bitter. Medium alcohol warming. In overall different black IPA, with high ABV, well balanced and highly drinkable. Be aware of it !!!

Bottle, 50cL. Home. A very dark brown beer ; light red garnett hues through the light ; big beige creamy head ; great retention. Aroma of resin, herb, fruit (blackberry, black currant), toast. Medium sweet balanced with medium to heavy bitter ; light dry ; light warming. Full body, oily medium texture, average to soft carbonation, fruity dry finish, warming background. Overall, intense fruity aroma ; powerful ; a bit too much oily for me.

From old notes. From bottle at Copenhagen Olfestival 2012. Dark brown almost black color with light beige head. Roasted malty and hoppy aroma,caramel, citrusy, pine, light grassy. Sweet and biter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation
Very solid black IPA. The sweetness of the base lingers on with the hoppy aroma. Balanced.
Very dark brown with a tiny brown head. Malty and hoppy tones. Malt, roasted, fruit and hops. Medium to full body with a nice bitter / roasted finish.
Poured deep dark brown with an off white ring. Aroma of sweet fruit and light malt. Medium body, flavour is medium sweet, lightly bitter.

Draft at Orsted Olbar. Pours clear brown with a small tan head. Aroma of dark fruits, red fruits, light leather, sweet malt, caramel and a light chocolate note. Flavor is over moderate sweet and bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Tap at the Ørsted Ølbar, Copenhagen. Poured a clear dark brown with a frothy white head. The aroma is roasty, grassy hop. The flavour is moderate bitter with a spicy light pepper, woody hop bitter palate and a lingering bitter finish. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

On tap 26 april 15 @ Biercab, Barcelona.
Darkamber/reddisch color, with off-white head.
Aroma malts, sweetnotes, hops.
Taste: sweet malts,some alcohol, bitter hoppiness.
On tap at Biercab. Black colour with tan head. Herbal, roasted and chocolate aroma. Herbal ,resinosu, roasted and chocolate taste. Medium body.
13.12.2014. Cola like but darker, reddish. Intense aroma of roasted malts, piney hops, sweet malts. Taste has plenty of piney hops, bitterness, sweet black malts, sweet malts, even some chocolate.

Pours a dense dark brown with a slight off white head. Light candy, sherbet sweetness, light woody ash in the background, lemon too. Full body, medium carbonation. Booze its fairly upfront though not overwhelming
Dark, ruby colour with great, beige head. Massive hoppy aroma (herbs, citrus fruits) and sweet malty notes. Taste is also sweet with strong herbal notes. Medium and short bitterness

Draught @ Taphouse. Pours dark red unclear brown with a beige head that leaves some lacing. Aroma is fruity, malty and sweet. Flavour is sweet and bitter. Medium to full bodied, average carbonation. Finish is pine bitterness, some alcohol bite and malty sweetness.

My?la?em ?e piana b?dzie trwalsza.. Jest be?owa, lacing, kaskaduj?ce b?belki dwutlenku w?gla kolor ciemny br?z wpadaj?cy w czarny. Do?? klarowne. Aromat ?liwki suszone, troch? kawa, generalnie jak imperial stout, brak aromatów chmielowych. Jest to mocarz, w smaku s?odycz i du?a kontruj?ca goryczka. Bottle 50cl. Roast malt and pine hops. Black with a beige head. Roast and pine hops,which fades quickly. Nice balance.
Bue en bouteille de 50cl. Nez sur le houblon, pointe d'amertume. Au palais, 2 étapes : la première sur l'amertume et le houblon, la deuxième très café, tres maltée. Incroyable !

UPDATED: MAY 24, 2015 En meget intens og fyldig smag, der er godt afbalanceret. Massere af blomstrende humlearoma i rigtig IPA-stil i virkelig godt samspil med en kompleks omgang malt. En aroma af tropiske frugter, chokolade, duften af fyrretræer om sommeren, lavendel, rosiner, ristet malt, halmballer, brun farin, roser - og også lidt alkohol (der dog er forholdsvis afdæmpet, på trods af en styrke på 9,3%). En lang bitter eftersmag.

Strong/medium aroma with dark berries and raisin and a hint of fruits. Appearance dark red/golden with medium, natural white head and hazy liquid. Medium/strong taste follows aroma, though theres licorice and salty licorice also. Almost more like stout than BIPA. Raisin and other bit sweet notes with medium/strong hops. Also some malts can be detected. Balanced with wide taste spectrum. Long, hoppy aftertaste with licorice and dark berries. Medium palate with medium carbonation. Overall very nice beer, though the style is a bit controversial.

Draught at Craft Beer Co., Clerkenwell. Poured a really dark brown, with a tiny halo of beige head. Aroma of red meat, berries and oak. Prunes in the flavour, with brown sugar and grain. Finish was molasses, dark malt and burnt toast.

Draught at the Ukkometso, Tampere, Finland.
Dark reddish colour with a small whitish head. It wasnt that bright in the bar but for me it wasnt black - not even close. 
Strong bitter hoppy aroma with resiny notes and sweet maltiness. The flavour is a bit darker malty with strong bitter hoppiness. Drinkable. Some alcohol there too.
Keg at Cask Bar and Kitchen. Deep black uber hopped. Some coffee. Cheese. Velvet smooth. A real treat.

500ml bottle. Clear dark brown colour with red glimmer, late awakening, average to huge, thick, frothy to creamy, fairly lasting, and lacing, beige to tan head. Roasty dark malty aroma with citrusy and herbal hoppy overtones, lots of grapefruit, chocolately dark malty basis, hints of coffee, some orange, hints of resin and pine. Taste is moderately sweet, chocolately dark malty, hints of coffee, a touch of honey, fruity hoppy notes of orange, mandarine, a bitter hoppy and a bitter roasty dark malty touch, some resinous and piney hop. Fantastic beer, dangerously drinkable, well hidden alcohol.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Stass place. Thanks Stas. Pours brown to red with a beige head, aroma of chocolate, hops, marmalade and orange, flavor of chocolate, roasted malt, orange, marmalade, bitter, medium bodied.

Tap at Craft Beer Co. Clerkenwell. Pour is black with a large caramel head, aroma is toffee, caramel. Taste is toffee, malty, bitterness, coffee, minimal fruitiness, body is medium, carbonation is soft. Very nice
Beczka; barwa brunatna z czerwoni refleksami. Intensywny aromat chmielowy, zielony, zywiczny, le?ny. W smaku bardzo chmielowe, zywiczne,.sosnowe goryczkowe.
Tap at olutexpo. Clear deep brown color, tanned head. Aroma is sweet malts, hoppy, some roasty notes. Taste is balanced malty, hoppy, little roasty, long hoppy finish.
Keg at Craft Beer Co Islington; dark brown pour with a big creamy light tan head, roast malt and pine aroma, taste has smooth roasted malts, chocolate a hint of coffee, pine needles.

Very dark ruby colour, beige head. Aroma of liqurice, lots of hops,dark caramel. Taste is light sweet, light bitter, very nice ballance between ipa and a stout. Medium body, oily to creamy texture, average carbonation. Its pretty amazing this brew

Bottle from Systembolaget. Best before 29.01.2017. Pours dark brown. A medium amount of tan head. Bitter, some sweetness. Medium body and carbonation. A bit dry. Pine, roasted malt and coffee and some plum flavour. A good beer.

Deep brown color, beige head. Coffee nose, licorice, resin, fruity notes. Roasted malt taste, chocolate, coffee, moderate bitterness, hint of alcohol. Medium body with a smooth mouthfeel, soft carbonation, oily texture.

UPDATED: APR 3, 2015 Wspaniały aromat czekolady, kawy, prażonego słonecznika, palonych słodów, do tego amerykańskie chmiele, z całym ich dobrostanem, od cytrusów, przez żywicę, po trawiasto-leśne akcenty. W smaku - pełna, gęsta, wręcz czekoladowa podbudowa, z cytrusowymi akcentami, coś ala brownie cytrynowe, świetnie zbilansowane, do tego grzejący szlachetny alkohol,nie udający że się kryje, ale nieprzeszkadzający. Goryczka potężna, ale przyjemna. Kolejne piwo z tego browaru i po raz kolejny czuję się rozłożony na łopatki.

Bottle sample at a tasting. Thanks Stas. Brown-black with a small creamy head. Hoppy and roasted malts aroma. Sweet and malty with coffee, dark chocolate, dried fruits, medium hoppy bitterness. Dry-ish, medium-full bodied. Nice, but too heavy.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Stass place. Thanks Stas. Brown with red hues. Aroma of roast and some "green" and piney hops. Roasty flavor with some chocolate and nice bitter hops, somewhat piney. Medium-bodied.

From tap at Pikkulintu. Pours brown, not so clear and the head is not very large. Doesnt really look like a black IPA but it probably is. Aroma is sweet and has some roast in it. Kind of like baking bread and then burning something up. Liquorice. Taste is sweetish, chocolate mocha. Hop are giving some unique character, drying the mouth with bitterness at the same time while sweetness is also there. Really nice actually, fresh and sweet and bitter at the same time. Good brew, very enjoyable.

Bottle @ home. Pours dark brown with thick lasting beige head. Initially aroma is all hoppy and pine. However the roast and coffee quickly takes over. Taste is mainly coffee, roasted malts and licorice, and some pine and grass. Mouthfeel is foamy and bitterness lasting and high. Great BIPA

- with thirst, Niklas

18 avril'13
-->Imperial Black IPA noire, 9.3%, 500ml
-noir opaque, reflet acajou; mousse veloutée, fine
-nez choco, café, réglisse, alcool
-entrée graine de café enrobé de chocolat, vanille, mélasse, réglisse
-amertume de torréfaction et houblon
-finale café/choco, cendrée, menthe, alcool; amertume soutenue

A via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pitch black pour with creamy tan head. Aroma has lots of balanced notes. Liquorice mixed with freshness from the hops. Taste is rich with caramel like texture and balanced bitterness.

500mL bottle, pours black with a small beige / tan head. Nose brings out dark fruits, medium roasted malt, and a decent piney hop kick. Flavour is quite strong, bringing out loads of piney hops upfront, balanced by a robust roasted malt and dark fruit backbone. Nothing restrained about this - a big wallop of hops, but also a big ass malt component. The malt component outshines the hops after a while. Could be balanced better, but this is still very nice.
Bottle - Roast malt and pine hops. Jet black with a very rich beige head. Roast and pine hops, with a huge bitterness that goes as quickly as it comes. Very nicely done.

UPDATED: AUG 11, 2014 50 cl bottle. Pour a frothy dark brown with a tanned fluffy head. Feathery light dry-hopped hops and wood evade the bottle on opening. Full-bodied hop-sugar flavours with some hops in the background. Roasted barley offers a plus. Light mouthfeel (one of the most important characteristics) for a high abv which is fitting for the style, still surprising compared to other black IPAs. Cheer to this evolution. The Hophorn is an easy digestible and con-memorable beer, with lots of different flavours combined. My best Black IPA to date! Anyone tell me where its on draught, or old matured bottles to be found.

Keg at Craft Clerko. It pours near black with a medium beige head. The nose is bitter-sweet roast, dirt, cocoa, pine needles and some citrus peel. The taste is bitter, roasty, pine, toast, dirt, grapefruit peel, sherbet, slight soapiness, charred wood and some alcohol with a dry, finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Pretty punchy cda action. Mighty decent.

On tap at CBC Covent Garden. Pours a dense dark brown with a slight off white head. Light candy, sherbet sweetness, light woody ash in the background, lemon too. Full body, medium carbonation. Booze its fairly upfront though not overwhelming - theres light licorice, treacle, very light soy with candy too, and lemon... Its good.

Barwa ciemnobrązowa lekko opalizująca z rubinowymi refleksami. Piana ładna dość szybko się rozpadła, krążkując na szkle. 
Aromat owocowy z czekolada i palone słody oraz ziołowe aromaty chmielu. 
Trochę ciałka jest, wysycenie średnie. Czekoladowo kawowa paloność, z owocowymi akcentami i bardzo przyjemną średnio wysoką ziołową goryczką.﻿

Lasting thin beige frothy head atop an opaque black body. Nose of roasted nuts and molasses. Very sharp hops and deep toasted malt. Lasting pine bitterness through the finish. Good. Purchased at Metro Liquor University Heights.

Dark brownish beer with a small beige head that unfortunately fates quickly - quite pleasant carbonation though. Lovely aroma with both dried berries, dried abricot, malt, a very floral hoppiness, notable alcohol notes and a distinct earthiness as well. Very complex taste that combines the best from two worlds: the roasted maltiness with both coffee and dark chocolate from the stout and a nice bitter, citrus-like, fruity and floral hoppyness from the IPA that is expressed especially in the end. Long aftertaste. Great beer.
Bottle from Hammelhus. Pours dark brown/black with a good tan head. Sweet hoppy taste. Slightly citrus notes, roasted malts, caramel, chocolate notes. Smooth palate. Quite nice bittersweet finish.

Keg at CBC Islington - London. Pours clearish, red-brown with a creamy, tan head. The nose holds lots of piney hops, some boozy fruits, dark bread, perfume. Medium sweet flavor with steady bitterness, burnt pine, warm alcohol, dark berries. Medium to full bodied with average carbonation. Warming alcohol on the finish with oily hops, torched wood, dirt, grapefrut rind, charred pine. Very good.

On tap @ La Fine Mousse. Dark brown with a small ring of beige foam and little lacing. Aroma of roasted malt, piney hops, light citrus and hints of chocolate. Taste is moderately bitter with roasted malt, pine and light citrus. Medium body. Medium carbonation. Moderately dry finish. Alcohol is well hidden and its quite drinkable considering the abv. Good Black IPA.
On tap at La Fine Mousse. Dark amber color, quickly dying tan head. Aromas of fresh hops. Nice balanced taste, sweet with long lasting bitterness.

50 cl bottle. Pours dark brown, like coke, with small creamy head. Cured ham and fresh hops in aroma and taste. Well balanced like everything from Hornbeer. Quality brew.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
650 ml bottle. Pours a clear dark brown with light head. Beautiful aromas of dark fruit, pine, cola, and roasted malt. Flavors of pine, roasted malts, liquorice,, and burnt sugar. Very nice.

W aromacie mnóstwo mlecznej czekolady, paloność, lekka kawa, od chmielu początkowo aromat leśny, po czasie przechodzący w owoce tropikalne (w polewie czekoladowej). W smaku jest nieco gorzej, wyraźna mleczna czekolada, wysoka, ale przyjemna goryczka, i niestety lekko przeszkadzająca nuta alkoholowa. Całość zdecydowanie warta zachodu.

Bottle at Bruuveri. Black color, beige head. Bitter taste with hops, citrus, roasted malts, pine, licorice, chocolate and a bit of nuts. Bitter finish with hops, roasted malts and nuts. Excellent black IPA.
Backlog. Sample at Copenhagen Beer Festival. Dominated by licorice, raisins, dried fruit and caramel.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours dark brown with a large dense tan head. Aroma is hoppy with citrus together with a nice chocolate and coffee backbone, some caramel notes. Taste has a sweet carmel malty backbone with chocolate, coffee and a bitter grassy hops. Smooth medium body and a nice chocolate and grassy hop finish, soft carbonation.

Very dark colour with big and fluffy beige head. Intensive aroma of citrus(lots of grapefruit!), roasted malts, dark bread, chocolate and minimal alcohol. Taste is heavy sweet on the beginning and very hoppy and bitter aftertward. Finish is extremely long and really bitter. Despite of strong bitterness, its well balanced and quite drinkable. Fantastic example of strong black IPA.

Bottle shared with friends @ La Capsule, Lille - FR. Color: dark black beer with really small carbonation and small brown head. Smell: rye, malt and hoppy nose. Black bread, caramel. Taste: nice explosion of flavors of malt and hops in good balance. Really good and drinkable in this style. Aftertaste: malty and wet bitterness.

@ Havregatan. Flaska från Systembolaget (61:-). Rostade toner, humlig, fruktig, stor sötma, karamell, besk, medelfyllig. Lång och besk avslutning.

Keg. Dark brown, beige head doesnt endure long. Smell - rose water orange Centennial. Body is medium, carbonation low, not foamy. Taste - burnt toffee, dried dark fruits, orange, more Centennial, finishes with a soft bitterness. Decent.

(Bottle) Dark brown colour, almost black, with lasting beige head. Malty, roasted nose with notes of dark bread, chocolate, roasted malt and pine needles. Black. Fruity grapefruit, green berry, pines on nose, with a good roasted barley, soft chocolate espresso backing. Full soft body, very intensively flavoured. Soft, slight rubbery roastedness, green hoppyness. Well bittered, but soft palate. A slightly resinous, powdered chocolate, finish. Really nice ale for the dark afterworks here. Full and almost creamy soft, with lots of good flavours.

Bottle at Bruuveri, Helsinki. Aroma of heavily roasty dark maltiness, plenty of chocolate, coffee and also pretty much piny hoppiness. Taste is both malty and very hoppy. Initial sweetness lingers surprisingly long before balancing bitterness starts to feature. The combination of rich roasty chocolaty notes and piny and grassy elements is delightfully rich. Taste is very long; the palate round, full and smooth. Excellent black IPA that is very close to an imperial stout in my opinion.

Couleur : très noire, peu de mousse. Nez : très expressif, sur le café, un peu de fruits noirs mais aussi des fruits exotiques (mangue, passion). Bouche : texture épaisse, un peu sucrée, superbe ampleur aromatique, les 135IBU passent tout seul. On retrouve un mélange de café et de fruits exotiques. Finale : très longue, légèrement amère. Un modèle de Black IPA.

(50 cl bottle from Toft Vin; BBD: July 23rd 2016) Pours black with ample, creamy and tan head. Good retention and beautiful lace. Aroma is both hoppy (resin, spruce) and malty with notes of toffee and licorice. The aroma is somewhat remniscient of Beer Heres Dark Hops. Oily texture, soft carbonation, full body and a finish with all of the aroma notes present - i.e. well balanced malt and hops although they are not that well defined individually.

Pours a very dark brown body with a medium brown head that reduces to foamy islands and a ring of bubbles at the walls. The aroma is very strong, sweet, delicious and definitely on the hoppy side. I do get some lightly roasted notes, dark caramel and chocolate, but the overripe tropical fruits are dominating. Also some citric hints. The taste is moderate sweet and the long-lasting finish is heavy bitter. Strong flavours of overripe tropical fruits, dark caramel and chocolate mid-palate and bitter coffee and resinous notes in the finish. Close to full body, oily texture and quite soft carbonation. A wonderful DIPA with a touch of stout and porter.
[50 cl bottle, enjoyed 2 years before BB date, from Kastanielys, Sjællands Odde, Denmark]

UPDATED: NOV 2, 2013 500 ml. bottle bought in Vin & Delikatesse Huset in Holstebro.
Poured into a snifter and the aroma of the hops used hit you straight away. Creamy and hoppy palate, but not much taste from the Stout malts are to be found. It is what it sats it is: a dark stout - and a great one! Lovely beer!!

pours dark brown with a resilient beige head, good retention and nice lacing. dark almost smoked malts, burnt chocolate, bit of ashes and vegetal notes, maybe a bit stale as this bottle is not quite fresh, pine and resin, molasses, shy fruitiness underneath. moderate carbonation, medium body - oily, sticky and heavy, slightly harsh peppery-piney finish. o-k.
650 ml bottle. Pours a clear dark brown with light head. Beautiful aromas of dark fruit, pine, cola, and roasted malt. Flavors of pine, roasted malts, liquorice,, and burnt sugar. Very nice.

A colablack beer with an almost medium and beautiful, beige head. The nose is balanced, roastiness and some chocolate, grapefruits and fresh pine forest. Taste is also balanced, roastiness, coffee and some liquirice, a medium bitterness is grapefruity and slightly piney. Medium bodied, nice and smooth to drink. The simple beer, but thats not bothering, the great balance is the best part of this black IPA, a very good beer.

Dark brown color. Aroma: Chocolate, hops, caramel, vanilla and coffee. Taste: Hops, chocolate, vanilla, coffee, licorice and roasty. Soft carbonation, bitter finish. Very drinkable at a rather high ABV. Definitely makes sense to classify this as a Black IPA, but I dont think I got it very fresh, the hop presence could be more up-front. Pretty sweet. Its definitely not bad at this stage, I just have a feeling it has been even better!

Tap at CBC Islington, 29/08/13.
Light black/extremely dark mahogony brown with a good sized light tan head.
Nose is light roast, sugars, cocoa, toffee fudge, mineral notes.
Taste comprises chocolate pudding, light pine, brown sugars, bubblegum, hop presence evident.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, sweet finish with a touch of roast countered by some hop bitterness.
Pleaseant enough CDA, the 9.3% is very well hidden, however a little overly sweet for my own personal taste in regard to this style.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: 27th August 2013Craft Islington. Keg. Clear deep red - brown beer. Little pale cream coloured head. Smooth and softish palate. Fine carbonation. Smooth and slightly sweet dark malt cream, luxuriant. A little dark chocolate but no roast or bitterness. Touch of red berry fruits. Smooth piney hops underpinned by light citrus and tropical fruits. Finishes soft and creamy with all flavours coming together. A sumptuous treat of a double black ipa.
Keg at CBC. Dark brown with orange tints. Nose of chocolate, orange, cream. Very sweet flavor, orange chocolate, vanilla. Luscious but too sweet, though a grassy, bitter finish.

Tap at Craft Clerkenwell. Dark brown/black colour, small golden head. Aroma is boozy, bit of citrus, DIPA toughness. Taste is nice. Good bitterness, decent amount of roast. (end of a long day rating).
Tap at Bruuveri, Helsinki. Originally rated 25082011. Colour is black with small head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, hops and malts.

Thanks to bu11zeye for sharing this bottle. Brown-red pour with a tan head. The aroma is full of pine and grass with some toffee and tea notes. The flavor is light smoke, toffee, caramel, resinous pine, alcohol and a medium amount of bitterness. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2014 23.04.2012, 0,5l bottle sampled @ Maltmisjonen tasting:
Fruktig sødmerik lukt med preg av mørk malt, masse humle, svidd vingummi, mørk sjokolade, lakris, kaffi. Fruktig tørr smak med preg av mørk malt, masse humle, svidd gummi, mørk bitter sjokolade, lakris, gras. God bitterhet som set godt. God.
On the black side. A sweet light porter. Nice but a bit too sweet, too much caramel and not enough hops
Predominante aroma cafetero tostado. Espuma densa y muy duradera. Black IPA excelente y muy fiel al estilo, para repetir! Le pega muy bien un trozo de queso de oveja curado.

Bottle - 500ml. Black body with brownish glints and a thin beige creamy head. Nice, complex malty/hoppy aroma with fruity, brown sugar, vanilla, cocoa, and yeasty hints. Its rich, robust hoppy taste carries malty, oaky, plummy, and some licorice notes. Ends with a long, sharp, warming bittersweet finish. Very enjoyable!

(On tap) alla spina al Red Bear pub a Marghera (VE). Bella schiuma fine, aderente e lenta a scendere, colore marrone scuro, aroma con note di caffè, caramello, resina di pino, note erbacee, al palato corpo avvolgente con bassa carbonazione, caffè tostato, cioccolata amara, caramello e malti tostati, una certa salinità, finale lungo e secco e amaro. Forse la migliore imperial black Ipa che abbia mai bevuto.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

quite thick beige head that disappears slowly with lacing. coffee-cola coloured and still somewhat transparent. aroma of oats, slight hop, butter and some skunk. taste of coffee and liquorice with a long finish of liquorice. medium body and soft carbonation. well balanced, nice one!   bottle 50 cl @ cata cervezorama / best before 29-01-2016

Bottle. 9.3%. Best before 29.01.16. Pours a clear golden/reddish brown with a creamy khaki head. Good lacing. Smooth hoppy aroma on a malty background. Hints of the sea. Fat, dark fruit flavour, a bit roasted, with liquorice, toffee and hops. A bit cloying, but nothing severe. Rather bitter finish. Lingering dry and a bit tart bitterness with a touch of perfume and grass. Mild alcohol burn. Nice palate. Overall pretty damn good; full-bodied and well-balanced. 09.05.13.
Bitch black beige medium. Søtlig lakris, kaffe aroma. Crazy kaffesmak, bitter ettersmak. Holy shit....

Botella. Color negro con corona beige densa y duradera. Carbonatacion baja. Aroma caramelo café licor y mucho lúpulo resinoso. En boca cafetosa y resinosa con el alcohol muy presente pero no molesto. Postgusto largo lupulado y cafetosa
Mörk brun öl med beige skum. Doft av kaffe och humle, främst citrus och tallbarr. En kraftig men ändå balanserad humlebska som går bra ihop med kaffe och maltsmakerna.
[@ Öl och whiskymässan, Malmö] Svart med tunt brunt skum. Kaffe, kakao, söt aroma. Beska naffsar till lite i käken, frisk och balanserad.
On tap, rated from backlog. Aroma of caramel, malt, citrus, orange. Taste is sweet with lots of caramel. Bitter profile with mainly citrus notes

0,5l flaske, mørke brun øl, tæt lysbrun skum, dufter humlet, kaffe noter, karamel, lidt sød, men god bitter eftersmag. Lækker lækker!

Free Føroyar!!!

Bottle, 50 cl. Dark almost black with a decent tan head. Sweetish light roasted aroma, not that enticing. Sweet dark malty flavor, smoothly roasted, fruity flowery hoppy, light citrus. Hasn't got the expected lingering bitter finish. A slightly let down.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Heavy odor and heavy taste of this beer. The aftertaste is also quite heavy but not too dry. A really good beer this.

On tap at Barcelona Beer Festival 2013. Small Pint (20cl). Dark brown colour with medium beige head. Intense resin hops on the nose, some citric notes. Taste is coffe, licorice, dark sugar and hoppy bitterness (not comming from de coffee). I expected more bitterness considering the smell. Nice roasted malts also. No alcohol presence. Medium body, average carbonation. Good beer.
Golden with medium head. Taste soft and grainy with smooth bitter finish, some caramel.

Ar: Hornbeer, masters of controlling the hops, Burst of tropical fruits, passionfruit, grapefruit, resin, mango, oranges, citric, pine, light notes of licorice, coffee and a light roastiness, ABV well hidden. 
Ap: black colour, medium beige head, lacing.
F: marked sweetness, fruit candy, medium bite for the style, light notes of licorice and coffee, grapefruit, floral, resin and soft tropical fruits. 
P: soft carbonation, medium body, very Smooth.
T: Until recently I thought I didnt like BIPAs, turns out I just hadnt had good ones.

Courtesy of Erik & GittaDark brown color, with small head. The aroma is nice, clearly hoppy, with some roasted malts. Good flavor of caramel, dark caramel, some roasted malts, and correct bitterness; moderate residual sweetness; the final shows some more roasted nuts, and some hop resins.Not really a Black IPA, more like a very good American Brown Ale; well executed and deeply pleasant.

Grifo. Vaso Tumbler. Saboreada en feb´13. Color negro intenso y espuma beige. Corona cremosa que deja copiosos anillos y collares. Aromas de cacao y lúpulo fresco redondeados por fragancias florales y de maltas torrefactas. El perfil de sabor se define por el café dulce y quemado y el amargo contundente. Cuepo medio/ligero y carbonatación suave. El amargor permanece en el prolongado final. Retrogusto de cafá y chocolate fundido. ABV bien enmascarado.
On-tap. Tumbler glass. Enjoyed on feb´13. Deep black in color. Beige froth & creamy crown. Copious collars & rings. Cocoa & fresh hop aromas rounded by roasted malt & floral fragrances. Sweet burnt coffee & sharp bitterness defines the flavor profile. Ligth to medium body. Soft carbonation. Bitterness lingers into a long finish. Coffee & fudge chocolate on the aftertaste. ABV well hidden.
Ottima birra una delle mie black ipa preferite!!!!!!
Really nice taste and aroma, this is a good thing to drink. [short review due to it coming from my backlog]

UPDATED: SEP 16, 2015 Flaska från SB. Smak och doft av mycket humle, citrus, karamell, chokladtoner och tydlig smak av Läkerol Original. Mycket frisk och fruktig, bra balans, goda smaker i en fin komposition. Bra beska!

En kraftfull svart IPA. Mycket humle, karmamell, chokladtoner och en aning citrus. Mycket beska men en angenäm sådan. Rated sunday, february 10, 2013.
Godt smakfult øl.  God søtlig lukt.  Gir en fulkommen smaksopplevelse både på munnfølelse og ettersmak.  Et øl som må prøves.

Pours dark brown/black with small tanned head. Aroma of fruit and roasted malt. Taste of ripe fruit, roasted malt, grapefruit and some dark chocolate and coffee. Its quite sweet and dry but a little abrupt in the finishing bitterness. The overall score would be higher with some more bitterness!
UPDATED: FEB 2, 2013 Virkelig en god IPA som også minner om en porter med mye humle. Så her er det nesten to øl i ett. Dobbel nytelse...

Kaatuu lasiin mustana ja kestävällä, isokuplaisella vaahdolla. Haju on jopa pistävän humalainen, hieman sitruksinen ja savuinen. Maku on erittäin tasapainoinen, paahteisen maltainen, sitruksinen ja hieman savuinen. Humala jää jopa yllättävän paljon taka-alalle, mitä hajusta voisi päätellä. Suutuntuma on ohuehko ja mieto. Kokonaisuutena maistuva ja erittäin tasapainoinen olut.

50 cl bottle from Papsoe. Thanks Henrik! Best before date of 3/20/15. It pours a dark brown color with a khaki head. The aroma is very nice with pine and citrus hops backed up nicely by some caramel, cocoa, plum and slight hints of raisin. Very sweet, like hop encrusted raisinettes. Yum. The flavor is similar with sweet grapefruit, orange and mild pineapple up front followed by more cocoa, raisin and roasted malt near the finish. Very sweet, fruity brew. Good hop presence. Alcohol is barely noticeable. Super tasty. I really enjoyed this one.
Bought in a beer shop in Vejle, Denmark. It is very good black IPA with everything required to be a good decent beer.

Coffee aroma, brown head, nice black apperance, this was a good beer, a strong in %. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at home. 
Very dark borm color. Dark offwhite foam. 
Earth, chocolate, coffe, grass notes in the aroma. 
Really nice blend of malt and hops. 
Very full taste. 
Really nice brew. !!


Bolton Brew Rocks !!

Flaske: Sort IPA er ikke min øltype, men her fungerer det faktisk rigtig godt. Masser af humle i duften. Smagen er ikke brændt men de mørke malte kan smages ovenpå en fin humling. Nærmest ingen bitterhumle hvilket igen er en god ting.
650ml bottle poured a black color with aromas of roast, chocolate, citrus, and hops.  Flavors follow suit, with a weird aftertaste, glad I got to try this one out, interesting beer for my liking.

Bottle thanks to bu11zeye with a best before of 26/03/2014. Pours with a hazed brown hued body with a small tan head. Aromas are spicy, hoppy and herbal with light roast and chocolate. Flavors are chocolate, fruity, juicy citrus, earthy and roasty. Quite bitter with an overall bitter balance. Lively bubbles and dry with a lasting bitterness. Feels very PNW despite its international origins.
Bottle. Fruity aroma. Black colour. Small tan head. The flavour is sweetish with a good grassy hop note to balance. A little cream or vanilla. A good version of a dark hoppy beer.

Black body, huge light brown head. Intense hoppy aroma with grassy hops, pine, some grapefruit, and coffee. Full, well carbonated palate. Great bitter flavour with grapefruit and pine, as well as coffee and some dark chocolate. Excellent and very well balanced.

Bottle sample at Beer Enthusiast release tasting. Has a dark and deep brown colour and is quite unclear, with some light beige head. A wonderful fruity aroma of hops, coffee, leather, dried fruit, prunes, and a nice roasted character in the end. The beer has a wonderful coffee flavour with bitter and dark chocolate and dried fruit. Has a very smooth mouth feel, and medium bitterness. A beer with a great balance, and reminds me of a mixture of IPA and a stout/porter, but is more on the IPA side.

Bottle. Nose has a lot of alcohol and some hops. Taste is burned, slightly sweet with a lot of hops an alcohol in the finish. Nice beer but slightly unbalanced. Long dry finish with some sweetness. Not my choice for best Danish beer.

(500ml bottle, BB 26 03 2014)  Pours a hazy amber body with a medium beige head.  Aroma of pine, grapefruit, caramel, and chocolate.  Flavor of caramel, earth, pine, roasted malt, chocolate, and grass with a dry, bitter finish.

UPDATED: APR 16, 2012 50 cl bottle. Pours black with a large, tight, three finger latté brown head. Good looking. Aroma is very nice - coffee, chocolate, fruity hoppiness - tangerine, passion fruit, baked apples, raspberries, still rather fresh and tangy. As it warms is becomes soapy, synthetic and medicinal in its fruitiness. Taste is similar, though the roasted malts are not as present as in the aroma. There is a lot of sweetness from the malts, chocolate notes, even a hint of vanilæa ice cream. The hops are present, mostly in the sense of fruitiness, mango and pineapple, and as it warms, the hoppiness follows the nose with soapy characters. Not a lot of bitterness, which makes it a bit too sweet for me. But all in all, very tasty and enjoyable, all though some more bitterness would do it good.

Style et résumé: Imperial Black IPA. 
Comment: Bouteille de 500ml. par IPB. 
Description: Belle bière brune avec une mousse. Le nez est complexe, il est un beau mélange de caramel et de houblon. Les houblons sont résineux. La bouche est agréable, les houblons sont biens présents et le tout bien supporté par une superbe base maltée. 
Note: 7+/10
UPDATED: JUN 9, 2012 180511: Dark brown color with fine head. Roasted and good hoppy aroma. Flavor is again hoppy with fine balanced roasted..

On tap @ Schouskjelleren 22 feb 12, together with Visionthing and Mr A. Deep dark ruby red colour with a beige head. Hoppy, caramel and some fruity notes in the aroma. Rich hoppy, caramel and fruity flavour.
Black with brown head. Nose/taste of roast cocoa, chocolate malt, hints of vanilla, pine, resin and dank hops. Chalky mouth feel. Medium body.

Jag har svårt att ta mig förbi faktumet att ölen luktar tallbarr men efterhand så lägger chocken sig och ölen visar att den är värd att dricka. Men det är inte för den goda smaken utan för den spännande och svårpreciserade smaken. Slutsats: spännande.

In short: A world-class by-the-book Black IPA.  That simple.  One of the best of its kind.
How: Bottle 500ml.  Consumed 2.5 years before expiration date (so probably relatively fresh)
The look: Dark brown body topped by a medium beige head
In long: Nose is uber-hoppy with a ton of juicy citrusy hops over a nice freshly baked black cake.  Taste is.  A solid malt backbone, roasted but not too roasted, chocolaty but not too chocolaty, thick but not syrupy, no alcohol presence, only a light sweetness sensation.  And then a truckload of hops that feel fresh and vibrant.  Citrusy, resinous, grassy, leafy.  Very tasty bitterness that never feels aggressive even thought its resinous character sticks to the back of the mouth for what seems like a full minute.  Drinks like a 5% session Black IPA.  Yep, a Black IPA lover wet-dream.  Probably in on of my personal top-5 Black IPA so far, exactly like I love them, its like this brewer read my mind to make this beer, but I hope nobody can actually read my mind, that would be embarrassing, with the midgets porn and all...
Bottle. Pours dark brown/blsck with a small head. Aroma american hops, malts, some chocolate. Medium palate. Very well balanced. Not Bad.

50 cl bottle @ Olutravintola Konttori, Tampere.
Originally rated on 30.06.2011. (8+4+9+4+16).
Pours deep dark ruby red colour with medium off-white head. Aroma of liquorice, ripe fruits, roasted malts, hops and caramel. Flavour of caramel, ripe fruits, liquorice notes, some syrup and mild vanilla. Complex brew with bitter palate and sweetish aftertaste.
5516
Bottle 500ml. Color dark red/brown with medium head. Aroma malt, caramel, hop, citrus, orange. Taste sweet, hop, citrus, caramel, bitter.

Bottle, pours black with small tan head. Aroma is very hoppy and also some roasted malts. Taste is hoppy with some tropical fruits but also has roasted malts, and some coffee. Says on the bottle that they tried to make a mix of ipa and stout and it like that. Like it alot
Pours very dark red with a high head. Aroma is fruits and some roasted malts. Flavor is some roasted malts, alcohol and lots of hops. Very nice.
Ekstremt dyprød. Egentlig svart. Lavt kremaktig skum som fester seg til glasset. God fruktig aroma. Fersken. God fruktig smak - litt tyggegummipreg. Lite annet.

500ml bottle, dark mohagany color, with some reddish highlights, and a thick pillowy beige head, with a mild molasses, subtle smoked earthy peated, chocolate, caramel, toasted malt in the nose, with some mild toffeeish, floral lemon, grapefruit peel, leafy, grassy hop accents, with a hint of fruitcake in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate, with a warmth, sweet mild earthy toasted, caramel, light roasted, chocolate malt, dark dried fruity, yeastiness character, with a good flowery leafy, grassy, candied citrus peel hop backbone, and some lemon marmalade, zesty lime rind flavors, leading towards a fruity, citrusy, leafy, grassy hop bitterness finish.

16.10.2011 On tap at Scouskjelleren mikrobryggeri, Oslo. Dark brown colour with tan head. Very rich with good malty body. dry bitterness with notes of juniperus or some kind of pine-tree flavours. Good beer.
Bottle. Dark brown colour with a beige head. Aroma is peach, alcohol, malt, hop. Flavour is peach, alcohol, malt, hop, pine, citrus. Nice beer.

Bottle: Poured a pitch-black color ale with a large light brown foamy head with good retention and some nice lacing. Aroma of green fresh hops is quite powerful with some light resin and piney notes. Taste is a mix between green hops with piney and resin notes mix in with some quite dry roasted malt. Body is average with light oily texture with good carbonation and no apparent alcohol. Very well brewed with more hops then I had anticipated. The only thing I could see improving in this beer is a fuller body.

500ml picked up at the new Barley Wine store in Copenhagen. Looks attractive in the glass with a fawn-coloured head leaving spotty lace behind, and a body that is very dark with a ruby glint. Inviting bittersweet smell of liquorice and resin. Well balanced flavour of red oranges, pine, anise and chocolate malts. Big, dry bitter ending containing sweet hints of dark chocolate. Full bodied, still smooth on the swallow. An enjoyable black ipa (hotel room, Copenhagen 02.11.2011).

Draught @ 3 Små Rum on November 10. Pours black with a creamy grayish brown head that slowly dissipates. Smell sweet with roasted malts, sour peaches, some grapefruit zest, burnt wood and cheap coffee. Taste is dominated by heavily roasted malts, ash and resin. Its bitter with some sweet notes from sundried tropical fruits. Finish is dry, bitter and fruity. Very nice!

This one runs a fine balance between hops and fruity sweetness. The taste and aroma is appropriately complex, there are pine cones and herbs on the bitter side and coffee and berries on the sour/sweet side. Finish is coffee-like. Colour is black and head is light brown. (Tap)

On tap at Schouskjelleren, Oslo. Near-black body, medium creamy off-white head. Aroma is licorice, cough medicine and hints of herbs and grass. Taste is cough medicine, pine, licorice and hints of camphor and pepper. A bit strange, as is common with Hornbeer, but OK.

Pours a dark brown color with  ruby highlights and a thick, creamy, light brown head. Very appealing aroma of green, floral, slightly citrusy hops with roasted malt and some caramel sweetness. The flavor is quite solid, theres a strong hops presence providing somes green, floral and citrusy flavors, the malt manifests  roasty, caramel elements providing some balance between the hops and malt, it finishes with lasting bitterness. The body is medium with a slightly vinous texture and moderate carbonation. This is quite good, somewhat different from a lot of Black IPAs, well-done!

On tap at Schouskjelleren. Misty, deep ruby-copper with a creamy, off-white head. Aniseed, dark dried fruits, pine, spruce, raisin on the nose. Liquorice, light sweet and acidic with a bitterness that lingers. Heavy carbonation.  Grows in the mouth. Full body.

Bouteille de 500 ml obtenue via Importations Privées Bièriopholie. Arôme: Odeur de céréales grillées et de citron. Apparence: La couleur est brune avec une faible densité de bulle. Présence dun mince col beige mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de céréales grillées avec une pointe de citron et de caramel. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement huileuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût légèrement houblonné. (Rating #3892)

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2012 Tap @ Schoukjelleren, Oslo. This is a deep deep red-brown body with a nice light creamy and light fluffy off-white head. Aroma is light roasted, dark malty, notes of chocolate, theres even some coffee in here. Lively carbonation, medium-bodied and the mouthfeel is light oily to light sticky. Nice chocolate and coffee flavors. Has a nice cutrus-hopy contrast to all the black and dark flavors. Also hints of licorice, before it end in a heavy dry finish! 
Sampled from 0.5l bottle @ Beer Enthusiast release party. Pours a deep deep ruby body with a small bubbly sidesticking beige head. It has a light hoppy aroma with a thin cold-coffee touch, also some hints of autumn leafs. Oily texture in the mouth and its average carbonated. Sweet with some nice licorice and chocolate flavors. Good hoppy bitterness all the way. Lasting soft roasted and sweet aftertaste. Surprisingly tasty and light warming. Yeah, not bad at all! Leaving a mouthdrying coffee feeling in my mouth. 23.04.2012
On tap at Schoukjelleren, Oslo. Pours dark amber with a small white head. Aroma is sweet malty and hoppy. Taste is deep malty, caramel with some grapefruity hops and light yeast.

Draft @ Delirium Hoppy Loft, Brussels.
Brune foncée, col léger beige.
Arôme de malt grillé avec pas mal de bon houblon citronné, le tout avec une pointe de réglisse.
En bouche, malt grillé avec une très fine amertume, liquoreuse et résineuse, qcq fruits noirs et un malt à la limite fumé avec en retrait des houblons américains donnant à la bière une profile de fruits tropicaux; pamplemousse et qcq épices.
Pas mauvaise, mais encore ici un cas de bière extrême que je trouve aurait été meilleure avec un abv juste un tout petit peu plus faible.

Bottle, vin-og-gaver.dk (via Garry Solway Cider Parsons). One of my favourite beers of recent times. Fantastic black IPA, deep ruby black, with a thick and foamy head, that stayed consistent throughout. Spicy hops, pungent pine aroma that gives a great bite on the tongue and a very full aftertaste. Plenty of blackcurrant and licquorice flavours give great contrast. This is a fine complex beer whose flavour really belies the ABV.

Bottle Murky brown ale with a small, creamy, khaki head. Good retention. The nose is fruity and chocolaty. Odd combination, but thumbs up. Medium to full-bodied with a buttery mouthfeel and feather-soft carbonation. The flavor presents very little chocolate or roast. Fruity, resiny bitterness balanced by fruity, caramely sweetness. Finishes mildly bitter and then dry. Blindfolded, I would not guess this is a black Ipa. Quite nice. Bottle courtesy of Maltzilla!

Slightly sweet aroma of roasted malt, dark chocolate and banana?, with fresh and spicy hop notes, lemon-like. Mmmmm! Taste is smooth malt with light chocolate tones and a nice hop aroma and a distinct bitterness in the aftertaste. A excellent beer, but after a while the taste becomes a bit too sweet!

Draught 0.20 L at Bruuveri. Slightly sweet and hoppy nose. Beige exspressolike head. Dark reddish black colour. Sweetish syropey malty and hoppy taste. Guite soft. Some hints of dark fruits in the taste. Alcohol is well hidden.
Bottle at Maltzillas tasting. Pours dark brown with tan head. Aromas of roasted malts and citrus and pine. Roasty and bitter flavors with some pine. Medium body with average carbonation.
Bottle thanks to Matzilla.  Brown pour with an off white head.  Roasty nose.  Sweet citrusy hop and caramel malt flavors.

500ml bottle from IPB. Best before 26/03/2014

Appearance : Dark amber with a medium head. Light lacing. Good head retention.

Aroma : Caramel with resinous hops. Rather piny. Light roasted malt notes. 

Taste : Light roasted notes with caramel and resinous hops. Piny and a bit floral. Finish is rather resinous with roasted malt mixed with caramel. a bit floral on the finish too.

Overall : Not bad. A bit too much caramel for a Black IPA. Interesting hop but a bit too resinous and astringent for my taste. Good but nothing special.

Shared bottle @Pikkulintu 24.7.2011. Poured brown color with a white head. Aroma is lovely, fruity hoppy with some herbal/medicine notes. Flavor is caramel, hops and sweet malt. Long smooth fruity finish. My first Black IPA.

UPDATED: JUL 31, 2011 Bottled. Pours deep brown with a red glow and with a large, creamy, tan head. Execellent lacing. Nose of roasted malt citrus, pine and chocolate notes. Sweet flavour with roast, citrus, caramel and  chocolate + light cofee notes. Medium to full bodied, creamy to oily  texture and soft carbonation. Nice and markedly bitter finish. A well composed Black IPA - Well done Hornbeer.

Bottle.Pours cloudy brown with an off-white head.Aroma of peach, perfume, cellar and dates and cheesy hops.Flavor is sweet and peachy with some malty, and piney notes.Medium body, average carbonation.Nice hoppy and sweet beer.

Bottle. A dark reddish brown beer with a big, rocky beige head leaving lacings. Some maltyness in the aroma, but mostly hoppy with pine cones and citrus peel. The flavor is bitter, slightly roasted and quite piney and citrusy. Full body, mostly dry, and pleasantly carbonated. Quite nice, not world class, but nice. Wouldnt mind drinking more of this. 110614
Dark brown of colour with a beige head. An aroma of roasted malt, sweets, hops and grapefruit. A flavour of hops, citrus, weak roasted and nice bitter.

UPDATED: JUN 15, 2011 At Copenhagen Beer Festival. Very dark brown to black colour, moderate tan head. Both aroma and flavour have a nice balance between the roasted malts and the resinous and fruity hops. Well behaved, despite is high IBU. Highly drinkable, very good.

Draught. Black colour, creamy beige head. Pleasant aroma, mixture of tropical fruity grapefruity/floral/resiny hops and smoky and slightly tar-like roastedness. Some ripe berries. Starts sweetish, rathercaramelly sweet and finishes dry, resiny, bitter and roasted with light chocolatey touch.  Smooth, silky texture, slightly thin finish.

Light head, some laces, brown
Delicious hoppy nose with citrus, fyr and dark fruit
Medium body, fine length, hoppy carachter.
Taste is caramel, bitternes, fyr and light grape.
A fine IPA

Tap (Pikkulintu, Helsinki)
7 Nice fruity hops.
4 Quite red, keggy head
7 Full malty taste, lots of fruity hops. Quite sweet, and definitely full.

Bottled. The aroma has roasty malts, pine, citrus. Hazy, brown coloured beer with an off-white-beige head. The taste is moderate bitter, bit sweet, has citric hops, roasty malts, hint of chocolate. Medium bodied. Nice one.

500ml Bottle (Thanks Svesse) - Dark brown with a foamy and lively head. Liquorice, toffee, coffee, chocolate, roasted malt and soapy hops in the aroma. The taste is fairly complex with some strong hoppy notes featuring along with notes of aniseed (black jack sweets), liquorice toffos, coffee and roasted malt. Very tasty and the best black IPA Ive tried thus far.

Draught @ Pikkulintu, Helsinki

Pours dark orange with a medium head. Aroma has hints of roast, chocolate, coffee and hops. Taste starts out quite sweet and fruity but finish is very roasty and hoppy. Great beer, a bit different than your typical black IPA.

Botlled from Systembolaget
Black with a large, creamy beige head.
Flowery, hoppy aroma. Roasted and sweet.
Oily and creamy mouthfeel.
A bit too sweet. Medium bitterness.
Fruity, roasted.

50 cl bottle from Systembolaget. Black color with medium off-white head. Smells of hops, grapefruit, citrus, pine, coffee and some roasted malt. Taste is dry with medium bitterness. Feels more balanced than most black IPAs. Medium bodied with nice carbonation. Very well made and more drinkable than other example in the same style.

(Draught at Pikkulintu) The beer poured dark brown and almost clear. Its head was dense, medium sized, long lasting and light brown. Aroma had malts, chocolate and hops. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were malts, hops, chocolate, mildly roastedness and medium bitterness. Aftertaste roasty and bitter. As this was supposed to be an IPA the roasty flavour and scent was not so fitting. Otherwise a good brew.

Bottle. Black beer with a small brown head. Citrus and pine aroma, soapy notes. Hoppy flavor, grassy, caramel, some chocolate notes.

Tap at Schoukjelleren shared with Daje. Black, thin creamy tanned head. Smess of citrus, zests and blackberries. Taste is sweet malty and else same as the aroma. First time i found blackberries though. Finish is quite bitter and hoppy. Black and cool

50 cl bottle, thanks to ekstedt!BB 05 01 2014, sampled on April 1, 2011Very long estimated BB date for an IPA?Black color, big tan to light brown head. Bottle (50 cl) from systembolaget. Dark reddish brown, medium beige head. Caramelly malt aroma with some vague roasted notes, citric and piney hops. Medium bodied and smooth. Quite sweet, with medium bitterness.

Served in Belgian glass at Pegasus Copenhagen. Dark low head and cellar temp. First rate in a long time. Nose is sweet citrus and dark malt sweet flavor and slightly thin in the mouth.  Seams more like a strong ale very nice.

Pours black with a light brown creamy head. Roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, green grass and citrus in the aroma, but it doesnt manage to bind together the malts and hops to one. Same with the taste, where the bitterness takes it hold while there is less hop aromas.

Pours deep muddy black colour with darky beige head. Very nice aroma of spices and floral notes. Medium sweetness and medium to high bitterness very well balanced. Round flavour. Full body, creamy, soft carbonation and again the balance between sweet and bitter in a long after taste. Very good.

Bottled:Pours dark (almost black) brown with a rich and creamy head. Hoppy aroma with some notes of roasted malt, soap and licorice. Smooth and creamy mouth feel. Hoppy flavour with some notes of toffee and coffee. Yummy!

Hazy dark brown, almost black, with a big lasting light brown head that leaves some lacings.
Lots of grass and pine needles on the nose, along with coffee, liquorice, soy, almond and citrus. Makes me think of Yeti.
Taste is roasted with a light sweetness and notes of bitter coffee, full chocolate and some dark fruit or berries. Growing grassy bitterness.
Medium to bigger body and small tickeling bubbles. Balanced and smooth going back and forth between staout/ipa/porter. Very nice!

Courtesy of niklas. Pours black with fluffy bubbly brown head leaving nice lace. Aroma is malty, fruity, a bit roasted, piny, soapy. Sourish malty mouthfeel. Flavor is malty, hoppy, peppery, fruity perry, but too much acidy. Thin palate. Finishes acidy sour.

(Bottle) Pours dark brown, black in the glass. Medium sized, light brown head. The aroma is fantastic, lots of creamy chocolate and pine - a surprisingly good combination. Also, clear tones of black currant and liquorice candy. Typical notes of coffee and citrus also notable. A light whisper of alcohol. The liquorice tones grow stronger as the beer gets warmer. Fantastic nose. The flavour is light sweet (maybe even light to medium), medium to heavily bitter and light acidic. Citric and roasted. A touch of dark caramel and smoke. The mouthfeel is clean and smooth with light to medium carbonation. Soft malty and hop bitter finish. Medium to full bodied.
